summary: The Merchant Marine Allies Partnership Act aims to allow vessels from allied foreign countries to participate in certain U.S. coastwise trade. It modifies existing laws to allow vessels built in allied nations to receive endorsements, and provides mechanisms for the Secretary of Transportation to authorize qualified vessels for specific trade routes. It establishes a Foreign Ally Shipping Registry maintained by the Secretary of State and provides procedures for adding or removing countries from this registry.  The bill also includes provisions related to crewing requirements and duty exemptions for repairs made in allied foreign countries.
